alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Grand and Battlement Mesas; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued March 20 at 4:14PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. …AVALANCHE WATCH IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MONDAY UNTIL 8 AM THURSDAY… *WHAT… Dangerous avalanche conditions are expected with high winds and heavy snow. Expect the Avalanche Danger to rise to HIGH (Level 4 of 5) during the night on Tuesday and continue through Thursday morning. *WHERE… Elk Mountains, West Elk Mountains, Ruby Range, Red Table Mountains, Holy Cross Wilderness, Sawatch Range, Independence Pass, and Sawatch Range. *WHEN… Expect dangerous avalanche conditions to begin on Tuesday night and last through Thursday at 8:00 AM. *IMPACTS… Heavy snow and strong southwesterly winds will create dangerous avalanche conditions. Large and dangerous avalanches will be easy to trigger once the new snow accumulates. Avalanches will run naturally. Fowler
